title: Is grammar important in writing an essay? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, Grammar plays an important role in essay writing. It have several reasons: It may help enhance accuracy. Punctuation is a great way to make your writing clear and fluent.Grammar rules can help learners develop a habit of thinking logically and clearlyA proper use of grammar is a sign of respect, both for speakers and listeners

Yes. In the first place, poor grammar simply conveys a poor impression of the writer’s educational attainments, social standing or professionalism. Assuming you are writing an essay as part of a scheme of assessment or examination, why would you want to leave your assessor with a poor impression of you? Secondly, poor grammar conveys uncertainty or lack of knowledge or understanding of your subject matter. If you cannot communicate what you want to say accurately and precisely, how is anyone to know whether you actually understand the subject of your essay? Thirdly, a good grasp of grammar is actually a positive aid to clear, logical thinking. It is a tool which helps you to organise your thoughts and say what you mean to say rather than what you think you are saying. Have a look at these: These 26 Hilarious Signs Are Exactly What's Wrong With People Today. My Brain Hurts. Okay, I accept that they were never intended to be used in essays - but they do demonstrate very clearly how poor grammar can lead you to places you didn’t want to go!
